meanings.definition: A type of small, brightly colored parrot native to Australia and the South Pacific.
meanings.sent1: The lories chirped happily in their colorful feathers.
meanings.sent2: I saw a group of lories flying gracefully in the sky.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to catch the lories but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: Her room was like a jungle, filled with lories of different hues.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant lories painted the sky with their wings.

meanings.definition: The plural form of the word 'lory', referring to more than one of these birds.
meanings.sent1: We counted the lories perched on the tree branches.
meanings.sent2: The zoo had a special exhibit featuring various lories.
meanings.sent3: The lories squawked loudly, causing a funny commotion.
meanings.sent4: The garden was alive with the fluttering of lories.
meanings.sent5: The children were delighted to see the colorful lories up close.
